answers.answer: Hi .. I am so glad you stopped by!   C~

HI, Totie, sorry it took so long for me to answer, I could not get into the computer yesterday!  Unfortunately there is not cure for IC, and technically you always have it however there are many great treatment options that can help you control your pain, burning, frequency etc.The first thing for all IC er's to try is the IC diet... many acidic food make things worse for us.  The big triggers are  Caffeine (Chocolate, coffee, soda), Cranberry, spicy foods,Alcohol, and smoking.  I would highly encourage you to go to the IC website I have set up to network patient here in Missouri and Arkansas.  Even though you may not be near here there are many helpful treatments listed.   I wrote one that is basically a newbie initially safe list that you can take to the store, it's calledHelp What Can I eat on this Crazy IC diet.  the website is www.  moarkic  . com  we can put direct links but Cheryl did tell me it was OK to send you to safe info. (There are many treatment options too!)The IC-Network has some great diet resources and the best diet list online too.their website is www ic-network.The ICA has a lot of great info too ww. ichelp  . orgThe Julie Beyer has written the best IC books too, these are listed on our website along with the link to her site nutraconsult .comFeel free to contact me with any questions I will help you any way I can!Hope that helps!Shelly

question: Hello MSKshelly. ChitChatNine told me to correspond with you concerning IC.Here is my history on the bladder. I have always had frequent urination (10+ years). It had never been painful, I would just go quite often (25+ times -voiding), even at night. When I would go to the doctor they would always just tell me to quit drinking so much liquids. I never had a UTI so they quit trying to figure it out. I drank anywhere from 36-48 oz a day. I was tested for diabetes, diabetes insipiduous, had ultrasounds, ct scan of kidneys. All okay. The kidey & endo basically told me to quit drinking liquids, so I stayed at 12-24oz a day, literally. It did not matter how much I drank, i would still have to go, i can not hold my liquids, if I do it becomes painful down there...I finally switched doctors due to other health factors going on. This one doctor had the concept of sending me to a urologist, which by the way after years of complaining I was never referred too. She did the cystoscopy & biopsy, it came back IC. She told me I have had it for years, so she has me on Pot K, and Bactrim, and Urelle. Those have helped a lot. I still go a lot, but I can hold it longer than I normally would.My question is, will this ever go away? Would having had graves/hyperthyroidism be a factor? I will not see my urologist for another 3 weeks, so I was just wondering. Is it normal for the kidneys to hurt from time to time with this?
title: For MSKshelly
